name: df-pj1
params: setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4, setvar s5
body: |- wceq(cpj1, cmpt(s0, universe, cmpo(s1, s2, cpw(cfv(cbs, cv(s0))), cpw(cfv(cbs, cv(s0))), cmpt(s3, co(cv(s1), cfv(clsm, cv(s0)), cv(s2)), crio(s4, cv(s1), wrex(s5, cv(s2), wceq(cv(s3), co(cv(s4), cfv(cplusg, cv(s0)), cv(s5)))))))))
bodyPretty: ‚ä¢ proj1 =(s0 ‚àà ùïå ‚Ü¶(s1 ‚àà P((Base ` s0)), s2 ‚àà P((Base ` s0))‚Ü¶(s3 ‚àà(s1[(LSSum ` s0)]s2)‚Ü¶ iota(s4 ‚àà s1, ‚àÉ(s5 ‚àà s2, s3 =(s4[(+ ` s0)]s5))))))
comment: Define the left projection function, which takes two subgroups ` t , u ` with trivial intersection and returns a function mapping the elements of the subgroup sum ` t + u ` to their projections onto ` t ` . (The other projection function can be obtained by swapping the roles of ` t ` and ` u ` .) (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 15-Oct-2015.)
